title: Contextualized Instructional Design Workshop for Adolescent Drug Prevention Education

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Practical-oriented education combining theoretical foundations and real-world applications of youth drug prevention for current practitioners.

learning_goals: When designing a youth drug prevention education program, one can apply at least three principles of contextualized learning.
Can explain the physiological effects of major drugs such as alcohol and narcotics and prevention strategies.
It is possible to evaluate and improve digital-offline integrated educational tools that can be utilized in school settings.

resources: Adolescent substance abuse prevention research materials

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
